thread.title: Verastem to Wind Down Mesothelioma Study
thread.title_full: Verastem to Wind Down Mesothelioma Study

author: morningstar.com
title: Verastem to Wind Down Mesothelioma Study
text:
Verastem Inc. said Monday that it will wind down a midstage clinical trial of its experimental mesothelioma drug after an analysis showed the drug wasn't effective enough to warrant continuing the study.
Shares of Verastem, down 38% this year, plunged 45% to $3.10 a share in premarket trading after being halted.
Verastem had been testing the drug, VS-6063, as a maintenance treatment following chemotherapy. The company said the drug was generally well-tolerated, but a Data Safety Monitoring Board review found the drug wasn't effective enough to continue.
Verastem said it is no longer enrolling patients in the Phase 2 study and has initiated a wind-down.
The company said it would re-evaluate its priorities and focus its resources on its other treatments.
Write to Chelsey Dulaney at Chelsey.Dulaney@wsj.com

(END) 28, 2015 08:45 ET (12:45
